prompt_markdown: What is a **virtual address space**? Why does each process have its own, and what are the main regions it contains?

criteria.name: definition
criteria.description: Correctly defines virtual address space as process's view of memory

criteria.name: isolation
criteria.description: Explains why each process has its own (isolation, security)

criteria.name: regions
criteria.description: Names key regions (stack, heap, text/code, data)

expected_key_points: virtual addresses are translated to physical by MMU
each process sees its own private address space
prevents one process from accessing another's memory
regions: stack, heap, code/text, data, BSS
